subject: History
title: Pearl Harbor: Day of Infamy
description: A quick, practical guide to Pearl Harbor: Day of Infamy.

hook.text: On December 7, 1941, Japan attacked a US naval base without warning. America went from neutral to fully at war.

buildup.text: Japan needed oil and resources to fuel its empire. An American oil embargo threatened to cripple its military.

discovery.text: 353 Japanese aircraft struck Pearl Harbor in two waves, sinking or damaging 19 ships and killing 2,403 Americans.

twist.text: Japan missed America's aircraft carriers, which were at sea. Those carriers would decide the Pacific War.

climax.text: Roosevelt called it a date which will live in infamy. Congress declared war the next day with one dissenting vote.

punchline.text: Japan woke the sleeping giantâ€”and paid the price.

quiz.question: What critical target did Japan miss in the Pearl Harbor attack?
options: The submarine fleet docked at the harbor
America's aircraft carriers, which were at sea
The ammunition storage facilities on the base
